titles.title: Prayer of The Year of Jubilee of Mercy

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7 v8 v9 v10 v11 v12

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
Lord Jesus Christ,
you have taught us
to be merciful
like the heavenly father,
and have told us that
whoever sees you, sees Him.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
Show us your face,
and we will be saved.
Your loving gaze freed
Zacchaeus and Matthew
from being enslaved by money;

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
The adulteress and Magdalene,
from seeking happiness
only in created things;
Made Peter weep
after his betrayal,
and assured Paradise
to the repentant thief.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
Let us hear
as if addressed to
each one of us,
the words that you
spoke to the Samaritan Woman:

verse.name: v5
verse.lines:
“If you knew the gift of God!”
You are the visible face
of the invisible Father,
of the God who manifests
his power,
above all by forgiveness
and mercy:

verse.name: v6
verse.lines:
Let the Church be your
visible face in the world.
It’s Lord risen and glorified.

verse.name: v7
verse.lines:
You willed that your ministers
would also be clothed in weakness,
in order that they
may feel compassion
for those in ignorance and error:

verse.name: v8
verse.lines:
Let everyone
who approaches them
feel sought after, loved,
and forgiven by God.
Send your Spirit and consecrate
every one of us with its anointing,

verse.name: v9
verse.lines:
so that the Jubilee of Mercy
may be a year of Grace
from the Lord,
and your Church
with renewed enthusiasm,

verse.name: v10
verse.lines:
may bring good news to the poor,
proclaim liberty to captives
and the oppressed.
And restore sight to the blind.

verse.name: v11
verse.lines:
We ask this of you
Lord Jesus,
through the intercession
of Mary Mother of Mercy;

verse.name: v12
verse.lines:
You who live and reign
with the father and
the Holy Spirit
forever and ever.
Amen.
